thread.title: Carl Lawson's status expected to be updated soon. Will he return this week?
thread.title_full: Carl Lawson's status expected to be updated soon. Will he return this week? | AL.com

author: Brandon Marcello | bmarcello@al.com
title: Carl Lawson's status expected to be updated soon. Will he return this week?
text:
Carl Lawson's future could become clear this week as the final month of the season nears.
Auburn's No. 1 defensive end and pass rusher has not played since the season opener Sept. 5 against Louisville due to an unspecified hip injury, but he has since ditched the crutches and could be nearing a return to the field.
Auburn (4-3, 1-3 SEC) hosts No. 19 Ole Miss (6-2, 3-1) on Saturday. Defensive coordinator Will Muschamp was asked if Lawson could make his return against the Rebels.
"I don't know," he said. "Coach (Gus Malzahn) will address that. He met with Dr. (James) Andrews over the weekend and I think Gus will address that Tuesday."
Malzahn addresses injuries and personnel decisions with the media Tuesday mornings. Auburn did not practice Sunday to rest following a quadruple-overtime loss at Arkansas on Saturday.
Lawson traveled with the team to Kentucky on Oct. 15 and Arkansas on Saturday, and did so without the support of crutches for the first time since injuries his hip in the first half agaisnt Louisville. He finished the season opener with four tackles, including a sack and two drops for losses.
"His presence means a lot for our guys," Muschamp said. "He's certainly a leader on our defense and a guy that is an experienced good football player, a productive football player. Part of being a leader is you've got to be productive. He's a guy that's been there and done that at a high level and continues to provide good leadership to our guys. Certainly, hopefully, if we get him back on the practice field this week it will be a huge bonus for us from a mental standpoint as much as anything."
Lawson returned to practices last week and was running along the sidelines during the Tigers' typical group practices. He did not participate in practices against teammates. He met with Andrews last week, too.
Muschamp said Wednesday "we certainly expect him back, unless we have some sort of setback."
Jumping out the gym
